poem:
**Dorm Room Starter Kit**  

In the bright whisper of morning  
she discovers necessities  
beyond textbooks—   
a toolbox, the rhythm of hangers,  
a fan's soft breath.  
With dreams precise as a surgeon's blade,  
she fashions her own light  
as a lamp does, resting on the promise  
of ingenuity,  
in a room transforming  
into her first true sanctuary.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Didn’t have a pillow’: the program kitting out foster students starting college When Ar’reiona Green was accepted to Sacramento State last year, she knew she would need books and school supplies. She didn’t expect to need a toolbox. Or hangers. Or that her dorm room wouldn’t come with a fan or a lamp. Like many first-year students, Green, who is headed into her sophomore year and plans to become a plastic surgeon, was excited about". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
